messages.title: Will you stand by Phil?
messages.content: Please get out. Vote for Phil Woolas. Stop the extremists in their tracks. Now.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet suggests a strong stance on illegal immigration, mentioning that 'The Lib Dems plan to give hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants the right to stay.' It implies opposition to this policy.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet seems to suggest a tactical situation where voting for Phil Woolas's party is presented as a way to 'stop the extremists in their tracks.'

issues.immigration: The leaflet implies a stance against allowing illegal immigrants to stay.

images.caption: Leaflet page with Phil Woolas and the Labour logo, including imagery of protestors and election messaging.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains potentially provocative imagery and messaging aimed at highlighting a threat from 'extremists' and positions the candidate as a bulwark against them. It is focused specifically on an immigration issue related to policy by the opposing Liberal Democrats.
